tweets.text:
"The company [@thameswater] even suggested that if residents wanted a more effective removal of waste they should make a claim on their household insurance."

So much then for the corporate soft and cuddly image.

https://t.co/6JLLuRUT95

@VisTran @SNorthantsC If you have reported to @SNorthantsC then contact them again. Fly-tipping is split between us and the local Council.  If its large scale waste involving 20 tonnes of waste or for hazardous waste, its 75 litres or more then this will fall under our remit.

Let's just recap on that shall we. 

70% of our chalk streams are over abstracted, not a single river in the country meets 'Good' overall environmental health and in 2019 water companies spent 1.5 million hours dumping sewage into England's rivers.

Welcome to regulatory failure. https://t.co/z41FkduAyp

tweets.text:
@ukskies @SoLongFrank @hhesterm @DefraGovUK @Feargal_Sharkey , yes him. Is the best person to follow on this, he has been pursuing @EnvAgency for years and holding them to task over their failings.
Farmers and Industry much more serious than a lot think

"The net effects (of climate inaction) will collapse ecosystems, slash crop yields, take out the infrastructure that our civilisation depends on, and destroy the basis of the modern economy and modern society", warns @EnvAgency in a burst of brutal honesty.
@JoKingDevon @TheTiercel @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice And another https://t.co/DhSIXilFn6
@CertusCC @EnvAgency @RachSalv @JamesBevanEA And EA officials have a cloak of invisibility, a magic device enabling them to disappear and be unaccountable. Beyond contemptible.

@VeritasFerre @SoLongFrank @hhesterm @DefraGovUK Is the poor quality of British waters all down to sewage discharge? I agree with you that bigger fines are a way forward, but perhaps not the only solution. How big a contribution is made by use of chemicals on eg farm land, where surface water drains into water courses?

@VisTran Hi, not to sure if the local water company or the Council doing any testing/tracing as i have seen this before but to be on the safe side, please report this to our Incident team on  0800 80 70 60. free contact 24/7. As we deal with water pollution incidents

Just reported the oil spill to @EnvAgencySW somewhere around Plymouth. As I had Heard nothing from the EA so far about it. Found another bird covered in oil, this one didn‚Äôt make it. Everything on the beach is covered In the stuff. Seems pretty bad @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife https://t.co/BjQN0KUdXc
@vja1999 @thenewgalaxy Perhaps there ought to be something like the old EU single payment scheme to farmers for home owners who keep their gardens green and make them wildlife friendly?
@deekinstow @StonebridgeLock @LeeValleyPark @EnvAgencySE @CanalRiverTrust @etlawlor1 They are! They've made Enfield the Portland, Oregon of London. Kudos @EnfieldSuDS!

@deekinstow @LDNWaterkeeper @LeeValleyPark @EnvAgencySE @CanalRiverTrust @etlawlor1 That is an end of pipe ‚Äúsolution‚Äù.
